    • prehtmlize

      public static String prehtmlize(String s)
      Return a string that represents s in HTML by calling htmlize(java.lang.CharSequence, java.lang.Appendable, boolean) with s, a transient StringBuilder, and true.

      (N.b. if no special characters are present, s is returned as is, without the expensive call.)

      Parameters:
      s - a defined string
      Returns:
      a string representing the character sequence in HTML

      public static void htmlize(CharSequence q, Appendable dest, boolean pre) throws IOException

      dest - where to append the character sequence to
      pre - a value indicating whether the output is pre-formatted -- if true then LFs will not be converted to <br> elements
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurred when writing to dest

      dest - where to append the character sequence to

    • breadcrumbPath

      public static String breadcrumbPath(String urlPrefix, String path, char sep, String urlPostfix, boolean compact)
      Convenience method for breadcrumbPath(urlPrefix, path, sep, "", false, path.endsWith(sep).
      Parameters:
      urlPrefix - prefix to add to each url
      path - the full path from which the breadcrumb path is built
      sep - separator to use to crack the given path
      urlPostfix - suffix to add to each url
      compact - if true the given path gets transformed into its canonical form (.i.e. all '.' and '..' and double separators removed, but not always resolves to an absolute path) before processing starts.
      Returns:
      HTML markup for the breadcrumb or the path itself
      See Also:
      • breadcrumbPath(String, String, char, String, boolean, boolean)
      • getCanonicalPath(String, char)

    • breadcrumbPath

      public static String breadcrumbPath(String urlPrefix, String path, char sep, String urlPostfix, boolean compact, boolean isDir)
      Create a breadcrumb path to allow navigation to each element of a path. Consecutive separators (sep) in the given path are always collapsed into a single separator automatically. If compact is true path gets translated into a canonical path similar to File.getCanonicalPath(), however the current working directory is assumed to be "/" and no checks are done (e.g. neither whether the path [component] exists nor which type it is).
      Parameters:
      urlPrefix - what should be prepended to the constructed URL
      path - the full path from which the breadcrumb path is built
      sep - the character that separates the path components in path
      urlPostfix - what should be appended to the constructed URL
      compact - if true, a canonical path gets constructed before processing.
      isDir - if true a "/" gets append to the last path component's link and sep to its name
      Returns:
      path if it resolves to an empty or "/" or null path, the HTML markup for the breadcrumb path otherwise.

    • getCanonicalPath

      public static String getCanonicalPath(String path, char sep)
      Normalize the given path to its canonical form. I.e. all separators (sep) are replaced with a slash ('/'), all double slashes are replaced by a single slash, all single dot path components (".") of the formed path are removed and all double dot path components (".." ) of the formed path are replaced with its parent or '/' if there is no parent.

      So the difference to File.getCanonicalPath() is, that this method does not hit the disk (just string manipulation), resolves path always against '/' and thus always returns an absolute path, which may actually not exist, and which has a single trailing '/' if the given path ends with the given sep.

      Parameters:
      path - path to mangle. If not absolute or null, the current working directory is assumed to be '/'.
      sep - file separator to use to crack path into path components
      Returns:
      always a canonical path which starts with a '/'.

      public static void readableLine(int num, Writer out, Annotation annotation, String userPageLink, String userPageSuffix, String project) throws IOException
      Write out line information wrt. to the given annotation in the format: Linenumber Blame Author incl. appropriate links.
      Parameters:
      num - linenumber to print
      out - print destination
      annotation - annotation to use. If null only the linenumber gets printed.

      project - project that is used
      Throws:

    • path2uid

      public static String path2uid(String path, String date)
      Generate a string from the given path and date in a way that allows stable lexicographic sorting (i.e. gives always the same results) as a walk of the file hierarchy. Thus, null character (␀) is used both to separate directory components and to separate the path from the date.
      Parameters:
      path - path to mangle. This is assumed to be relative to source root.
      date - date string to use.
      Returns:
      the mangled path.

    • uid2url

      public static String uid2url(String uid)
      The reverse operation for path2uid(String, String) - re-creates the unmangled path from the given uid.
      Parameters:
      uid - uid to unmangle.
      Returns:
      the original path.

      Returns:
      date embedded in the uid

    • fixPathIfWindows

      public static String fixPathIfWindows(String path)
      Sanitizes Windows path delimiters (if SystemUtils.IS_OS_WINDOWS is true) as Indexer.PATH_SEPARATOR in order not to conflict with the Lucene escape character and also so path appears as a correctly formed URI in search results.
      Parameters:
      path - path to fix
      Returns:
      fixed path

    • appendQuery

      public static void appendQuery(StringBuilder buf, String key, String value)
      Append "&name=value" to the given buffer. If the given value is null, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      buf - where to append the query string
      key - the name of the parameter to add. Append as is!
      value - the value for the given parameter. Gets automatically UTF-8 URL encoded.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the given buffer is null.
      See Also:

      public static String formQuoteEscape(String q)
      Escape a string for use as in an HTML attribute value. The returned value is not enclosed in double quotes. The caller needs to add those.
      Parameters:
      q - string to escape.
      Returns:
      an empty string if a parameter is null, the mangled string otherwise.

    • diffline

      public static String[] diffline(StringBuilder line1, StringBuilder line2)
      Tag changes in the given line1 and line2 for highlighting. Removed parts are tagged with CSS class d, new parts are tagged with CSS class a using a span element. The input parameters must not have any HTML escapes in them.
      Parameters:
      line1 - line of the original file
      line2 - line of the changed/new file
      Returns:
      the tagged lines (field[0] ~= line1, field[1] ~= line2).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if one of the given parameters is null.

    • dump

      public static boolean dump(Writer out, File dir, String filename, boolean compressed)
      Silently dump a file to the given destination. All IOExceptions gets caught and logged, but not re-thrown.
      Parameters:
      out - dump destination
      dir - directory, which should contains the file.
      filename - the basename of the file to dump.
      compressed - if true the denoted file is assumed to be gzipped.
      Returns:
      true on success (everything read and written).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if a parameter is null.

    • buildLink

      public static String buildLink(String name, Map<String,String> attrs) throws URISyntaxException, MalformedURLException
      Build an anchor with given name and a pack of attributes. Assumes the href attribute value is URI encoded. Automatically escapes the name into HTML entities.
      Parameters:
      name - displayed name of the anchor
      attrs - map of attributes for the html element
      Returns:
      string containing the result
      Throws:
      URISyntaxException - URI syntax
      MalformedURLException - malformed URL

    • buildLink

      public static String buildLink(String name, String url) throws URISyntaxException, MalformedURLException
      Build an anchor with given name and a pack of attributes. Assumes the href attribute value is URI encoded. Automatically escapes the name into HTML entities.
      Parameters:
      name - displayed name of the anchor
      url - anchor's URL
      Returns:
      string containing the result
      Throws:
      URISyntaxException - URI syntax
      MalformedURLException - bad URL

    • buildLink

      public static String buildLink(String name, String url, boolean newTab) throws URISyntaxException, MalformedURLException
      Build an anchor with given name and a pack of attributes. Assumes the href attribute value is URI encoded. Automatically escapes the name into HTML entities.
      Parameters:
      name - displayed name of the anchor
      url - anchor's URL
      newTab - a flag if the link should be opened in a new tab
      Returns:
      string containing the result
      Throws:
      URISyntaxException - URI syntax
      MalformedURLException - bad URL

    • linkifyPattern

      public static String linkifyPattern(String text, Pattern pattern, String url)
      Replace all occurrences of pattern in the incoming text with the link named name pointing to a URL.
      Parameters:
      text - text to replace all patterns
      pattern - the pattern to match
      url - link URL
      Returns:
      the text with replaced links

    • completeUrl

      public static String completeUrl(String url, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
      Try to complete the given URL part into full URL with server name, port, scheme, ...
      for request http://localhost:8080/source/xref/xxx and part /cgi-bin/user=
      http://localhost:8080/cgi-bin/user=
      for request http://localhost:8080/source/xref/xxx and part cgi-bin/user=
      http://localhost:8080/source/xref/xxx/cgi-bin/user=
      for request http://localhost:8080/source/xref/xxx and part http://users.com/user=
      http://users.com/user=
      Parameters:
      url - the given URL part, may be already full URL
      req - the request containing the information about the server
      Returns:
      the converted URL or the input parameter if there was an error

    • getQueryParams

      public static Map<String,List<String>> getQueryParams(URL url)
      Parses the specified URL and returns its query params.
      Parameters:
      url - URL to retrieve the query params from
      Returns:
      query params of url
